data.title: Vincent Van Bueren on LinkedIn: Van Agt in afscheidsinterview: 'Wil niet als rotjongen herinnerd worden'
data.meta_description: If you ask me about people who I admire for who they are/were and what they do/have done, then former Dutch prime minister Dries van Agt is definitely one of…
data.text: Gender equality manifests in many ways: equal pay, participation, and opportunities. Despite everyone’s progress, biases and unwritten rules continue to hold back many. At our recent 𝗙𝗶𝗻 & 𝗧𝗼𝗻𝗶𝗰 event, we explored these challenges and celebrated strides towards gender diversity and inclusion. 🌟 Our panel included Claire Godding (Febelfin and WoMen in Finance Belgium), Beatrice de Mahieu (BeCode.org), Ludivine Pilate (Puilaetco | A Quintet Private Bank), Rea B. (Projective Group), and Vincent Van Bueren (Gimv) and was moderated by Elodie D'Archambeau (Projective Group). Read the full article for all the 9 key takeaways, but here’s a sneak peek of this incredibly engaging discussion. 👉 https://lnkd.in/emt9uahn ✨Representation matters: Lack of it can lead to harmful assimilation. 🦹🏻♀️ Imposter syndrome: 75% of women in executive roles have faced it. 👨🍼Balancing roles: Women often juggle multiple pressures, from work to home. 🙅♀️Benevolent sexism: It's subtle but damaging. 👑 Queen Bee Syndrome: Thrives in toxic environments. 📢 Standing up: Speak out against microaggressions and support one another. Let’s continue to push for environments where everyone can thrive authentically and equally! 💪✨ Interested in joining our next editions? Comment below! ✨𝗦𝗲𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿 = 𝗡𝗟 𝗲𝗱𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 about the reality behind the WTP implementation (in Dutch) ✨𝗢𝗰𝘁𝗼𝗯𝗲𝗿 = 𝗕𝗘 & 𝗨𝗞 𝗲𝗱𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 about the importance of data, liability & control when using AI in your organisation #ProjectiveGroup #GenderEquality #DEI #WomenInFinance #FinTonic
